title: Just finished rewatching all of Buffy the Vampire Slayer, and I'm still getting something wrong about what made it such a great show?   Help me out here...
self_text: Alright, so I just finished my fourth complete rewatch of BtVS over the last few years (as well as watching Angel too), and I'm STILL trying to figure out exactly what makes it such an amazing show.  I know some of the obvious reasons like the characters, the wit, the horror aspects, the action, etc., but those are more things that make it *good* than what truly elevates it above other shows like Charmed or Sabrina the Teenage Witch.  What is it about Buffy that makes it a classic, a pillar of television, and still so widely popular after almost 25 years?  Is it the meta-commentary? The feminism? The way Whedon blended genres? Is it just nostalgia?  I'm really curious to hear your thoughts and opinions on this!

title: The story behind the name "Hulk Hogan's Beach Shop"
self_text: I was watching a youtube video about Hulk Hogan and they mentioned that he had a retail store in Florida called "Hulk Hogan's Beach Shop".  I looked it up and found out it went bankrupt after his sex tape scandal. However, it never explained why it was called "Hulk Hogan's Beach Shop", so I did some research of my own. It turns out that when Hogan first started wrestling as Hulk Hogan, he would wear beachy clothes to show off his body during interviews and events. He didn't have any real connection to beaches or shops but he wanted to give himself an image that appealed to women, so he dressed like someone who lived at the beach.   This is pretty weird and funny because his gimmick became all about patriotism and American values. So basically the man who gave America his love of Wrestling and the red white and blue used to dress like a pervert to get girls?  Does anyone else find that ironic?

title: I need help, my cat is a real asshole and doesn't let me touch him but he needs to be given medicine and I don't know what to do?
self_text: Hi everyone, so I have a 10 year old male tabby named Mr. Bigglesworth who is the most asshole cat that has ever existed. He doesn't like anyone touching him except for maybe when he wants food or his litterbox to be cleaned. I recently took him to the vet and found out he had an ear infection which means he needs to take ear drops twice a day. The thing is every time I try to put the ear drops in he runs away and/or bites me. I've tried everything, wrapping him in a towel, distracting him with treats, using gloves, even trying to hold him down (I quickly stopped after realizing it was wrong). Nothing seems to work. Has anyone else gone through something similar? If so how did you get your cat to take their meds? Any advice would be appreciated!

title: Cat has been throwing up a lot but isn't sick - is she trying to tell me something?
self_text: Hi, I have a cat who is about five years old and I've had her since she was a kitten. She's been doing this thing where she throws up after eating for the past week or so. It happens almost every day now. However, she doesn't seem sick at all! She still eats like normal, plays like normal, acts like normal, and she seems perfectly happy. When she vomits it's usually just food that hasn't been digested yet. Is there any way she might be trying to tell me something? Is it possible that my cat hates the new food? Maybe she needs to go outside more often? Any help would be appreciated.

title: Holding a cat like a baby
self_text: When holding a cat, you should hold it just as if it were an infant. It's important to support the cat's body with your arm and hand, and never let it dangle or feel unsupported. The cat will feel more secure when held in this position, which will make it less likely to struggle or become frightened. If you want to be extra gentle, you can also wrap the cat in a soft towel or blanket before picking it up. This will help to calm the cat down and make it feel more comfortable.  I think that cats need humans who are able to treat them like babies because they're so helpless and fragile.   If I didn't have any children of my own, I would have been a mother to a cat.  It is important for all kittens to be raised by mothers who are caring and loving.   Even after they grow into adults, kittens still need their mothers to love them and take care of them.  So whenever someone asks me why I love cats, I always tell them that they remind me of human babies.   They're so cute and innocent, and they need our protection.   The way they purr and rub against us is so endearing, and it makes me feel good to know that I'm making them happy.   When I pick up a kitten and hold it like a baby, I feel like I'm giving it everything it needs to thrive.   I'm providing it with warmth, security, and love, and that's what every living creature deserves.  And cats deserve all those things too!  In fact, they may even deserve them more than some people do.   Cats don't ask for much. They just want food, water, shelter, and affection. And in return, they give us their unconditional love and companionship. That's a pretty good deal, if you ask me.    Cats are truly special creatures. They're intelligent, independent, playful, and affectionate. They bring joy to our lives and enrich our existence. We should cherish them and protect them at all costs.   They're worth it.   Every single one of them.   And we should always remember that cats are not just pets. They're family.  So please, if you ever have the opportunity to rescue a cat, do it. You won't regret it. And if you already have a cat, give it a big hug and tell it how much you love it. Because cats deserve all the love in the world.

title: I just wanna be a good dad…   (And maybe get some sweet loot)
self_text: (This is kinda long, so sorry if it’s hard to read)  I've been playing for around 20-30 hours, and the game has only gotten more challenging with each passing hour. It wasn't bad at first. The beginning was easy enough. But now?  I have no idea what I'm doing anymore.   The thing that gets me most frustrated isn't even the combat. It's the inventory system. I spend about 75% of my time in the inventory menu trying to figure out how to organize everything. There are SO many items, but I don't want to waste my money on stuff that I won't need.  I also feel like I always run out of food. No matter how much food I take or craft, I can never seem to have enough. And then there's the equipment. Which armor should I upgrade? Which weapons are best for which enemies? Which skills should I focus on?   I am utterly overwhelmed.   My wife tells me that I need to relax and stop getting so stressed out over a video game. But she doesn't understand! This isn't just a video game to me. It's an escape from reality. It's a chance to be someone else. A hero who saves the world. And right now, I'm failing miserably.   I need help. I need guidance. I need a mentor.   So, here I am. Begging you, strangers on the internet, to teach me the ways of Elden Ring. Help me become the Tarnished hero I know I can be.   I promise to pay you handsomely for your wisdom. I will share all the valuable items I find with you. I will even name my next character after you.   Please, help me. I just wanna be a good dad…   (And maybe get some sweet loot)

self_text: I was at my friend's house and she made it, but I forgot to ask for the recipe. It was delicious!  I tried to make it myself, but it didn't taste as good.  Can anyone help me?

title: The most underrated character in the entire show.
self_text: I’m not talking about someone like Gammaliel, who is an awesome character but no one really talks about him outside of his fans.  I mean someone that literally no one talks about and is just always there.  It’s not a main or recurring character, it’s actually the guy who gives the two boys their food on set.  He literally shows up for 2 seconds every episode but he’s just there and you never think twice about him.   I’ve been watching the show since day one and only realized today that he was played by an actor because I’d seen him in other stuff before.   Anyways yeah that’s my take.

title: Can someone explain the ending?
self_text: So I just finished watching it and honestly was really confused with the ending of this show, like what did they even accomplish? They started out trying to kill a person who they thought was responsible for all of their problems, but then he was revealed to be innocent.  They could have just walked away at that point, but they decided to take him down anyway... Why? What were they trying to prove?  What was the whole point of this season? I also don't understand how they got out so easily without any consequence after committing multiple crimes. And why did they turn in the car? It didn't make sense.  I know I might sound dumb here, but please help me understand what exactly happened and why.

title: I'm a bit of an idiot who didn't study for the Chem 1A midterm and need help understanding what was on it! (No, I won't ask you to tell me the answers)
self_text: So, uh... I might have been a little overconfident in my ability to understand basic chemistry concepts going into Chem 1A. And as such, did not really prepare myself for the first midterm.  I know, I know. Very stupid. But now that the test is done, I realized how much of the material went right over my head when I tried to read through the textbook and lectures.  So I wanted to see if anyone could maybe give me a general rundown of what the topics were covered on the recent midterm?  Like, "It was all about stoichiometry," or "There was a lot of acid-base stuff," or "They focused heavily on thermochemistry." Just something so I can start focusing my studying correctly for the next exam.  Also, no, I am *not* asking anyone to tell me what the actual questions were or what the answers are.  I just want to get a better idea of what I need to be preparing for going forward. Thanks!

title: Looking for a roommate! (Female)
self_text: I am an undergrad student in my second year at UCLA and I'm looking to find someone to move into the Hilgard residence hall with me. The room is around $1,400/month but that includes utilities and access to all of the amenities on campus. If you are interested, please message me!  I'm looking for someone who is clean, respectful, responsible and doesn't mind occasional late nights studying or socializing. Also preferably female. :)   (If you don't have any interest in living with a girl feel free to skip this ad.)

title: I want to know if it's okay to give my dog the same treats as my cat?
self_text: My cat and I both love these new salmon flavored soft chews, but are they okay for my dog too?  I'm just worried about it because cats need taurine in their food/treats, so I don't want to accidentally make my dog sick by giving him something he doesn't need.

title: Just discovered that the last episode of Season 16 was a "clip show" and I can't stop laughing
self_text: The clip show from Hell's Kitchen is legendary, but the fact that they did it on Masterchef Junior?!  I feel like the editors just phoned in this whole season because all of them were so short and they didn't even bother to make an original episode for the finale.  It's not just me who feels like this season has been a mess, right?  The editing makes no sense sometimes and they seem to be cutting away from cooking and focusing on everything else.  It's ridiculous!

title: I hate the whole "Saitama is so overpowered he's boring" argument.
self_text: I think that it just makes people miss all of the subtle character work and writing in the series, which is why a lot of people can't get into One Punch Man. They spend so much time focusing on how strong Saitama is, they forget to appreciate everything else that makes the show good. Like for example, his relationship with Genos.   And like there are many other characters who are also super strong, but aren't boring like Tatsumaki or King.  And what really make them interesting is their personality. Which is something that Saitama lacks. So when people say Saitama is boring because he's too powerful, I think that it shows they don't have any appreciation for well written characters.

title: A question about the "cool" character arc of Paul in Season 3
self_text: So I just finished watching season 3 of You and it was a very good season! However, there is something that confuses me to this day, I don't understand why people say that Paul has a cool character arc?   I think he starts off as a normal guy who loves his son, but quickly becomes more like Joe by stalking Love and then turning into an extremely creepy dude who tries to control her life and even wants to kill Joe so he can have Love for himself? He also lies, cheats and steals throughout the whole show. I honestly think his character arc is really bad, I don't understand what makes him so cool. Does anyone else feel the same way?

title: I think it's cool that we all can agree to disagree and have our own opinions, but the fact remains that you are wrong...
self_text: But hey, that's just my opinion, you know? And if you don't like it, well then get out of here! You do not belong in my kitchen! You should be ashamed of yourself! (And your mother!)  I mean, seriously, how could you possibly think that pasta is better than rice?! It's a disgrace! A travesty! An abomination!   You're nothing but a bunch of elitist food snobs who think they're too good for simple, honest comfort foods! Well, let me tell you something, there's nothing simple about a perfectly cooked bowl of rice! It takes skill, finesse, and a deep understanding of the grain! You people wouldn't understand! You're probably all just sitting around eating fancy French pastries and drinking overpriced wine!  Ugh, I need to lie down. This has been so upsetting.  But still, you're wrong. Just saying.

self_text: Hey everyone, I'm looking for someone to share an apartment with near campus. My main priority is that you are also taking Chem 14A so we can study together! I'm a 2nd year and am pretty chill, so let me know if you're interested. :)

title: I miss my mom but she hates me for being a lesbian :(
self_text: My mother is very conservative and religious, so when I came out to her as gay she did not take it well. She does everything possible to avoid me and says I'm "living in sin" and that if I do not repent, I will go to hell. It makes me really sad because I love her and I want to have a relationship with her, but I don't know how to make her accept me.  I wish things were different, but I am who I am and I can't change that.   Is there anything I can do? Any advice would be appreciated!

title: I'm trying to make a character that is a "fallen hero" but it doesn't feel very well-defined, how can I better define the character?
self_text: I have an idea for a character who was once a great hero, and is now broken and disillusioned by their past experiences (I've been inspired by characters like Batman/Daredevil), but when I start writing him, he just feels generic.   What kind of things should I think about in order to help me flesh out his personality and motivations beyond just 'he used to be good now he's sad'?  I have some ideas already, but I don't know if they're enough or even if they're heading in the right direction.  (For example, I thought maybe he lost someone important during his time as a hero, which led him down a dark path.)
